medical_history.chief_complaint: Hypoparathyroidism characterized by hypocalcemia and hyperphosphatemia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In family A, the patient presented at age 28 with low calcium detected during routine testing and had experienced episodic carpal-pedal spasms and perioral tingling for the preceding 5 years. In family B, the patient presented at age 35 with muscle cramps, tetany, and psychiatric symptoms. Both patients were treated with oral calcium and calcitriol after diagnosis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Family A has a history of episodic symptoms consistent with hypocalcemia; Family B has a history of hypocalcemic seizures and chronic hypocalcemia in multiple family members.
medical_history.family_history: Nine additional members in family B are treated with vitamin D and calcium supplementation for hypocalcemia, indicating possible autosomal dominant inheritance.
